newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatia issues 300 mln Euro-kuna bonds at 12.5 pct.
newsitem.headline: Croatia issues 300 mln Euro-kuna bonds at 12.5 pct.

text.p: Croatia issued 300 million kuna in maiden two-year Euro-domestic bonds, syndicated equally on the Croatian and international markets, the Finance Ministry said in a press release on Wednesday.
Its said the issue maturing on December 18, 1998 carries a 12.5 percent coupon, with a price of 98.5.
"We expect that its attractive terms will appeal to a broad range of retail and institutional investors, who will be able to buy bonds through the managing banks' branches," the ministry said.
It said lead managers of the issue were Merrill Lynch International and Zagrebacka Banka.
They were joined in a co-lead management group by Creditanstalt-Bankverein and UBS Limited internationally and three Croatian banks Trgovacka, Dalmatinska and Varazdinska domestically.
